question: 3 red peaches, and some more green peaches are in the basket. _____, How many green peaches are in the basket?
Jesse's room is 7 feet wide. _____, What is the length of her room?
In a school there are 732 girls and _____. 682 more girls and 8 more boys joined the school. How many girls are there in the school now?
Rachel had to complete 3 pages of math homework and _____. How many more pages of reading homework than math homework did she have?
He also had 26 aquariums for saltwater animals. _____ and every aquarium had the same number of animals. How many saltwater animals does each aquarium have?
A book has 2 chapters across 23 pages. _____. How many pages are in the first chapter?
Frank had 33 pieces of candy. _____. If he put the remaining pieces into bags with 9 pieces in each bag, How many bags would he have?
David did 51 push-ups in gym class today. _____. How many push-ups did Zachary and David do altogether?
The school is planning a field trip. The school has 84 classrooms. _____. How many students are in the school?
Haley grew 20 trees in her backyard. _____. How many trees died in the typhoon?
Paul got a box of 531 crayons and _____. At the end of the school year he only had 391 left while not having lost a single erasers. How many more crayons than erasers did he have left?
A book has 2 chapters. _____. The second chapter is 80 pages long. How many more pages does the second chapter have than the first chapter?
Rachel had to complete 5 pages of math homework and yet more pages of reading homework. _____, How many pages of reading homework did she have to complete?
There are 544 pots in each of the 10 gardens. _____. How many flowers are there in all?
Robin has some packages of gum. There are 7 pieces in each package. _____. In all the number of pieces of gums robin has is 41. How many packages does Robin have?
Julia played tag with 15 kids on monday, _____ and 97 kids on wednesday. How many kids did she play with on monday and tuesday?
Danny collects bottle caps. He threw away 6 of the old ones at the park while he found 50 bottle caps new ones. _____. How many more bottle caps did danny find at the park than those he threw away?
Melissa scored a total of 21 points playing some games. _____. How many games did she play?
Danny collects bottle caps. He threw away 60 of the old ones at the park while he found 58 bottle caps new ones. _____. How many bottle caps did danny have at first?
Jackie has 10 apples. _____. How many more apples does Jackie have than Adam?
Together Adam and Jackie have 6 apples. _____ and jackie together do. How many apples does he have?
Ed had 30 more marbles than Doug. _____. If Ed had 91 marbles, How many more marbles did Ed have than Doug then?
Next on his checklist is wax to stick the feathers together. If the feathers require 166 g of wax and _____, How many more grams of wax does he need?
Randy has 86 blocks. _____ and 82 blocks to build a house. How many more blocks did he use to build the house than he did to build the tower?
There were 2 roses in the vase. _____ and cut some more new roses from her flower garden to put in the vase. There are now 23 roses in the vase. How many roses did she cut?
Every day Ryan spends 3 hours on learning english and some more hours on learning chinese. _____ and chinese everyday, How many hours does he spend on learning chinese?

Danny collects bottle caps and wrappers. He found 65 wrappers and _____. Now he has 31 bottle caps and 9 wrappers in his collection. How many more wrappers than bottle caps did danny find at the park?

The Razorback t-shirt shop makes $ 98 dollars off each t-shirt sold. During the Arkansas game and _____. If they sold 89 t-shirts during the Arkansas game, How much money did they make from selling the t-shirts during the arkansas game?
Baker made 170 cakes. _____ and bought 31 new cakes. How many more cakes did baker sell than those he bought?
Frank was reading through his favorite book. The book had 193 pages equally distributed over 15 chapters. _____. How many chapters did he read per day?
36 children were riding on the bus. _____. Then there were 12 children altogether on the bus. How many more children got off the bus than those that got on?
Paul got a box of 457 erasers and _____. At the end of the school year he only had 523 crayons left while not having lost a single eraser. How many more crayons than erasers did he have left?
Debby bought 301 water bottles when they were on sale. _____. If she has 157 bottles left, How many days did she drink for?
A chef had 58 apples. After making some pies, _____. How many apples remained?
Shirley sold 25 cases of boxes of trefoils. _____
After a typhoon, 13 trees in Haley's backyard died. _____, How many more trees died in the typhoon than those that survived?
In a school there are 632 girls and _____. 465 more girls joined the school. How many more girls than boys does the school have?
There are some baskets of peaches. Each basket has 4 red peaches and _____. If there are a total of 7 peaches in all baskets, How many baskets of peaches are there?
Bobby ate 23 pieces of candy. _____candy, How many pieces of candy does he still have left?
19 red peaches, _____ and 12 green peaches are in the basket. How many more red peaches than yellow peaches are in the basket?
Jesse's room is 2 feet long and _____. If each tile is of size 4 square feet, How many tiles does she need to cover the whole floor?
Jake has 12 fewer peaches than Steven who has 11 more peaches than Jill. _____. How many more peaches does Jill have than Jake?
The ring toss game at the carnival made the same amount of money each day. In total in 30 days they earned 420 dollars. _____. How much did ring toss game make per day?
Josh had 3 marbles in his collection. _____. How many more marbles did he find than those he lost?
A grocery store had 72 bottles of regular soda, _____ and 78 apples. How many more bottles than apple did they have?
For Gwen's birthday she received 7 dollars. She spent some money and _____. How much money did she spend?
Marco and his dad went strawberry picking. Together their strawberries weighed 4 pounds. _____. How much more did his strawberries weigh than his dad's?
They decided to hold the party in their backyard. They have 4 sets of tables and _____. If a total of 14 people will attend the party, How many more chairs will they have to buy?
Jack received 3 emails in the afternoon, _____ and some more in the evening. If he received a total of 10 emails in the day, How many emails did jack receive in the evening?
A chef had 40 apples and _____. After making some pies, he had 39 apples left. How many apples did he use?

The Razorback t-shirt shop makes $ 106 dollars off each t-shirt sold. During the Arkansas game and _____. If they sold 115 t-shirts during the Arkansas game, How many t-shirts did they sell during the Texas tech game?

After eating a hearty meal they went to see the Buckingham palace. There, Rachel learned that 703 visitors came to the Buckingham palace on the previous day. _____, How many visited the Buckingham palace within 25 days?
Paige was helping her mom plant flowers and together they planted 36 seeds. _____ and only 58 seeds grew into flowers in each flower bed. How many flower beds did they have?
28 children were riding on the bus. _____. Then there were 30 children altogether on the bus. How many more children got on the bus than those that got off?
There were 8 people on the bus. _____ and 3 people got off. How many people are there on the bus now?
Paige raised 16 goldfish and _____. Now she has 2 left. How many goldfish disappeared?
Baker sold 8 cakes. _____, How many more cakes did baker make than those he sold?
Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 12 cups of flour and _____. She already put in 2 cups of sugar. How many more cups of sugar does she need to add?
Paul got a box of 521 crayons and _____. At the end of the school year he only had 154 left while not having lost a single erasers. How many crayons had been lost or given away?
Allan brought 3 balloons and _____ and 59 balls to the park. How many balloons did Allan and Jake have in the park?
A book has 3 chapters. _____ and the third chapter is 3 pages long. How many more pages does the second chapter have than the third chapter?
Allan brought 2 balloons and _____. Allan then bought 3 more balloons at the park. How many more balloons did Allan have than Jake in the park?
After making some pies, chef had 2 apples left. _____, How many apples did he use?
Allan brought 5 balloons. If Allan and _____, How many balloons did Jake bring to the park?
Allan and Jake brought 3 balloons to the park. _____, How many balloons did Jake bring to the park?
There were 22 parents in the program and _____. How many pupils were present in the program?

Because of the decision Sofia asked the students to suggest specific types of food from a total of 66 choices. _____ and the rest did not participate, How many students participated in the suggestion of new food items?

There were 5 roses and _____. Jessica cut some more roses and orchids from her flower garden. There are now 12 roses and 2 orchids in the vase. How many more roses than orchids are there in the vase now?
The Razorback shop makes $ 115 dollars off each jersey and _____. During the Arkansas and Texas tech game they sold 113 t-shirts and 78 jerseys. How much more does a jersey cost than a t-shirt?
Paul got a box of 589 crayons for his birthday. _____. How many more crayons did he give to his friends than those he lost?
There are 4 different books and _____. If you read 19 of the books and watched 7 of the movies, How many more movies do you still have to watch?
5 children were riding on the bus. _____. Then there were 14 children altogether on the bus. How many more children got on the bus than those that got off?
Emily is making bead necklaces for her friends. Each necklace takes 8 beads and _____. How many necklaces can Emily make?
Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 6 cups of sugar and _____. She already put in 2 cups of flour. How many more cups of flour than cups of sugar does she need to add now?
Rachel picked 2 ripe apples from her tree. _____. If 6 of those are ripe and the rest are unripe, How many ripe apples did the tree have to begin with?
Danny has 21 bottle caps in his collection. He found some more bottle caps at the park. _____, How many bottle caps did he find at the park?
Rachel had to complete 2 pages of math homework, _____ and 10 more pages of biology homework. How many pages did she have to complete in all?
There were 12 people on the bus. _____. Each bus can not have more than 36 people. How many people are there on the bus now?
There are 896 skittles in Steven's skittles collection. _____ and 90 scales. If the skittles are organized into 8 groups, How big is each group?
Jack received 5 emails in the morning, _____ and 72 emails in the evening. How many emails did Jack receive in the morning and afternoon?
Frank was reading through his favorite book. The book had 3 chapters, each with the same number of pages. _____. It took Frank 607 days to finish the book. How many pages are in each chapter?
There are 6 houses on a block. _____, How many pieces of junk mail should he give in each house?
If the cave is 919 feet deep and _____, How far is the end of the cave?
Jack received 6 emails and _____. He then received 2 emails and sent 74 letters in the afternoon. How many emails did Jack receive in the day?
Luke gained 146 points in each round of a game. _____, How many points did he score in the game?
Shirley sold 10 boxes of trefoils. _____
Julia played tag with 17 kids on monday, _____ and 2 kids on wednesday. How many kids did she play with altogether?
In a school there are 697 girls and the rest are boys. _____, How many boys are there in that school?
3 birds were sitting on the fence. _____ and 2 more birds came to join them. How many more storks than birds are sitting on the fence?
3 birds and _____. 2 more birds came to join them. How many more birds than storks are sitting on the fence?
Julia played tag with 7 kids on monday and _____. She played cards wtih 20 kids on wednesday. How many kids did she play tag with altogether?

Winter is almost here and most animals are migrating to warmer countries. There were 87 bird families living near the mountain. _____, How many more bird families stayed behind than those that flew away for the winter?
Baker made 54 cakes. He sold some of them. _____, How many cakes did baker sell?
In a school there are 569 girls and _____. How many more girls than boys does the school have?
A grocery store had 30 bottles of regular soda, _____ and 41 apples. How many bottles did they have total?
Rebecca wants to split a collection of eggs into 3 groups. _____ and 15 eggs. How many eggs will each group have?
Baker made 8 cakes. _____ and sold 145 cakes. How many more cakes did baker sell than those he bought?
Matthew gave equal numbers of crackers and cakes to his 28 friends. _____ and 15 cakes initially, How many crackers and cakes did each person eat?
Jessica cut some roses from her flower garden to put in her vase. There are now 19 roses in the vase. _____, How many roses did she cut?
Lewis earns a total of $ 1216 during the harvest. _____, How many weeks did the harvest last?
